pros: Leadership support and professional development.
cons: Executive leadership communication did not always make it to front line workers.

review_title: You need a degree to get a decent job here. being talked about and made fun of.
pros: Good insurance that you pay high premiums for. 10% discount in cafeteria. PTO days you’ll rarely be able to use.
cons: Very prejudiced and uneducated homophobic people, only 33,000 in entire county. Very cliquey type high school atmosphere in a very rural area where nearest towns with decent restaurants that aren’t fast food are 55 miles away. Narrow minded and backwards gossiping group of people.

pros: Pay is decent and the work is good . Good health benefits unless you need something not in their network
cons: Upper management is impossible, a very high turnover rate because of it. Do not take employee concerns seriously, especially minority employees. A woman was physically assaulted by another employee and the assaulter was only given a warning. The woman in question quit because she felt unsafe. Also not very LGBTQ+ friendly. Oh, and no overtime.

pros: It's the only hospital in Vincennes.
cons: The administration does not care for its nurses.

pros: tube system works, epic gives charting reminders, plenty of supplies, floor nurses help each other
cons: Terrible onboarding, no preceptor set up, new nurse handed paper and is responsible for own orientation basically, desperately need more help BUT "this is what our staffing allows".  Bedside people work themselves half to death, nurses do a lot of aide work and all the nurse work too. Staff eat piecemeal in front of computers because no time for meals.  Managers either don't care, not interested or ineffective to change the problems. Atmosphere on unit is keep quiet and head down.  No open sharing.

pros: Employees are treated with respect. Great leadership from the CEO on down. Great people and a friendly atmosphere to work in. The hospital puts patients first and does a lot of good work in the community.
cons: Not a lot of room for career growth for some jobs. Personality clashes between managers could cause occasional hiccups in workflow for employees.

pros: It was a great job to gain more pharmacy knowledge for a future career in the hospital. I enjoyed my coworkers and my bosses. I and an all around positive experience in my time there.
cons: I worked some not pleasant hours. People would call in for medical reasons and I would be asked to stay extra time, but this is kinda the case in any hospital setting anywhere.

review_title: A nice place to work at.
pros: It is a nice place to work at. It is constantly being renovated and updated. Very nice atmosphere and the people are mostly friendly.
cons: Favoritism. It is rampant among departments. Add to that laziness, which is also another killer for employees. Managers can also be really harsh for no good reason.

pros: Great benefits with insurance, and honestly that's about it. Even with insurance changes in the last couple years, I find it hard to say even that when attempting to last a pro.
cons: Uncaring, unorganized, unprofessional, zero communication, unfocused as a whole when it comes to P.R.I.D.E.

pros: Great health benefits. My nurse manager worked around my schedule when I was in school. Acknowledges hard work. Staff is friendly.
cons: Nurses work every other holiday and weekend. They are attempting to go to every 3rd holiday and weekend though. I wish maternity leave was a little better.

pros: They are always friendly and there to lend a helping hand.
